chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ted J. Wasson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
08:53 a.m. - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cv289.  State files Second Amended Information.  Voorhees in receipt of Amended Information, waives reading.  Defendant pleads no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Schiek/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  In 14cv289 - Court orders vehicle to be forfeited. DA to prepare order - all other personal property to be returned to defendant as appropriate.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 5 yrs
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Engage in  psycho sexual/criminal counseling as deemed appropriate by PO
Jail 12 months - Presentence Jail credit 277 days  - W/Huber for all purposes
Register as Sex Offender
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights, NADVI given
Adjourned 09:43 a.m.
Second Amended Information

04:57 pm - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cv289.  Michlig states matter is not resolved - jury trial date requested.  Bail continued.  Jury trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

03:04 pm - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cv289.  Schiek states a resolution has not been reached.  Joint request for one more adjournment of a pretrial conference.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

02:19 pm - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court, via video,  with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files Amended Information.  Also calling 14cv289.  Voorhees in receipt of Information, waives reading - defendant stands mute - Court enters a not guilty plea.  Bail continued.  In 14cv289 - Voorhees states an Answer has been filed.  Court grants continuance.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
of Preliminary Hearing held 10-21-2014

10:18 am - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court statement to status of case/Defense Motion to Dismiss.  Insufficient evidence to find probable cause in the criminal case and/or the preliminary hearing for each count - Court finds the evidence at the preliminary hearing was sufficient to find that a felony was committed by the defendant.  Schiek/Voorhees statement to Court's ruling.  Bail continued.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
to Dismiss Counts 1 and 2 of Information

03:48 pm - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also calling 14cv289.  Michlig requests recess in order to create and file Information.  03:49 pm off the record.  03:57 pm - Back on the record.  State files Information.  Voorhees - In receipt of Information, waives reading.  Voorhees statement to motion on file prior to preliminary hearing.  Voorhees enters not guilty pleas.  Bail continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

to Suppress Statements

03:40 pm - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees files Motion to Suppress/Dismiss.  Schiek statement to motion.  Court will proceed with Preliminary Hearing and will rule on motion at that time of Arraignment.  Defense moves to sequester witnesses - granted.  State calls Oneida County LT Teresa Hook/Sworn/Direct by Schiek - State submit to Court Exhibit 1 (Officer's report)-Marked and Rec'd by Court - Witness ID's defendant/Cross by Voorhees/Court questions witness/Re-Cross by Voorhees.  Voorhees statement/motion to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause does exist and binds defendant over for trial.  Bail continued.  Voorhees to obtain date from BR II JA for motion hearing for dismissal of complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

01:36 pm - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court, via video, with attorney John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Voorhees/Schiek motion to amend bond - currently set at $50,000 cash - no contact with minors.  Court denies motion.  Bail continued.  
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
no contact w/minors

01:59 pm - Defendant Ted J. Wasson in court with attorney for today's purposes John E. Voorhees.  Defendant Ted J. Wasson in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Voorhees requests adjournment to allow time to meet with defendant.  In receipt of complaint, waives reading.   Court continues $50,000 cash bond.
